comments:
I am running this scenario with our own customized JRE.  I first create a tomcat 5.5 server in the workspace, and then set up the Axis 2 preference (Axis 2, version 1.2).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a Web project targeted against tomcat 5.5 server with Axis 2 facet.
2. Launch the Axis 2 Web service client wizard and create a Web service client (set the phase to deploy).
3. Repeast step 1 and 2 again with a new Web project.
4. During the second generation, no code will be generated and I got the following error message:

Exception occurred while code generation for WSDL  : org.apache.axis2.wsdl.codegen.CodeGenerationException: org.apache.axis2.wsdl.codegen.CodeGenerationException: java.lang.NullPointerException

More information:

Lahiru,

Please take a look at the code where it fails and see if you can determine what could be causing this problem.  Since you would not be able to recreate the problem without using the customized JRE Kelvin is using ,is there some more tracing you can put into the code to narrow down the problem?  We found that with one version of the customized JRE, the problem is always there but with an earlier version, Axis2 Web service client is fine.  The problem also does not exist in Sun JRE.

the vmargs I am using is:
-Xms40m
-Xmx768m
-XX:MaxPermSize=512M
I reran the scenario and found that the problem only occurred in Axis2 1.3 won't occur in Axis2 1.3.
Slight correction to Kelvin's remarks. The problem is occurring with Axis 2 1.2 and not 1.3.
The adopter product that uses the custom JRE is going to be built on top of WTP 2.0.2.  So retargetting to WTP 2.0.2.

Hi Kathy, 

I was able to look in to the problem with debugging the Axis2 1.2 and 1.3 versions against the client scenarios with all defaults. 

Here are my findings and suggestions, 

First of all regarding the changes on the code when it comes to Axis2 1.2 to 1.3 relate to this scenario,

There is an improvement done to XSTLTransformation code in the axis2 to write own custom templates and its needed to support for <xsl:include>

The issue is https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS2-2749

There has been changes to XSLTIncluderesolver which affects our scenario. That means when the document was passed the the resolver that comes inside was changed in Axis2 1.3 than 1.2 (improvement). 

The code commit revisions are 551018 and 551799. 
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/webservices/axis2/trunk/java/modules/codegen/src/org/apache/axis2/wsdl/util/XSLTIncludeResolver.java?r1=551799&r2=551798&pathrev=551799
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/webservices/axis2/trunk/java/modules/codegen/src/org/apache/axis2/wsdl/util/XSLTIncludeResolver.java?r1=551018&r2=551017&pathrev=551018

So you will be able to look in to the problem with the custom JRE with these changes.

One other thing to note is that in the InterfaceImplementationTemplate.xsl in the axis2-codegen module these changes are added to transform as, 

    <!-- import the databinding template-->
    <xsl:include href="databindsupporter"/>
    <!-- import the other templates for databinding
         Note  -  these names would be handled by a special
         URI resolver during the xslt transformations
     -->
    <xsl:include href="externalTemplate"/>
    
    
    <xsl:include href="policyExtensionTemplate"/>

First please try removing the other 2 includes (externalTemplate and policyExtensionTemplate)while keeping the databindsupporter and see the error still persists. 

Please go through with these information and see the custom JRE issue can be resolved. 

Thanks 

Lahiru

Sorry about not giving an update in this bug.  We've been able to workaround the problem with the custom JRE by switching the default XSLT transformer (which got switched recently).  Depending on if that XSLT transformer can be switched back as default or not, we might or might not have to look at other alternatives.

With either Axis2 1.2 or 1.3, there's significant performance degradation (even though it eventually failed in Axis2 v1.2 but was OK for Axis2 v1.3).  So most likely, changes you pointed out that was put into this area contributed a bit to the difference in behaviour.  However, the fundamental problem is the new XSLT processor is not handling the Axis2 code generation case well.

Is this switch is done through replacing a jar, or like tweaking some system properties or is this done through code level. If can be explained this will be some valuable information for the Axis2 project to work with custom JDK's.
Thanks

Created an attachment (id=80078)
Patch

Please take a look at the proposed patch to see if you agree with this approach.

Sounds Good. +1 for the patch. 
Lahiru
Fix released to R2_0_maintenance and HEAD as v20071011954.
Kathy , since the fix in now on the codebase, guess we can close this issue.
